title: DOM-based XSS in store.starbucks.co.uk on IE 11

profile.name: Starbucks
profile.about: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit -- one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time.

vulnerability_information: We've found DOM XSS on store.starbucks.co.uk and other related domains such as store.starbucks.fr and store.starbucks.ca. It appears to be a JQuery based DOM XSS in the parseHTML sink. In order to trigger the XSS you need to use IE11 and the PoC will visit the url first, wait 5 seconds and then revisit the same url to trigger the XSS. Here is the PoC: PoC visit using IE11 It may be possible to make this PoC work in Edge, too. Here is a stacktrace of where the source is accessed: Error at Object.get hash [as hash] (:1:29568) at Object.initialize (eval at (:1:31716), :1:2524) at HTMLDivElement.eval (eval at (:1:31716), :1:6085) at Function.each (https://store.starbucks.co.uk/on/demandware.static/Sites-StarbucksUK-Site/-/en_GB/v1497508834714/js/generic.min.js:28:379) at a.fn.init.each (https://store.starbucks.co.uk/on/demandware.static/Sites-StarbucksUK-Site/-/en_GB/v1497508834714/js/generic.min.js:22:134) at a.fn.init.$.fn.tabs (eval at (:1:31716), :1:765) at HTMLDocument. vulnerability_information_html:
We've found DOM XSS on store.starbucks.co.uk and other related domains such as store.starbucks.fr and store.starbucks.ca. It appears to be a JQuery based DOM XSS in the parseHTML sink. In order to trigger the XSS you need to use IE11 and the PoC will visit the url first, wait 5 seconds and then revisit the same url to trigger the XSS.

Here is the PoC:
<script>
function poc() {
var url = 'https://store.starbucks.co.uk<img/src="1"/onerror=alert(1)>',
win = window.open(url);
setTimeout(function(){win.location=url}, 5000);
}
</script>
<a href="#" onclick="poc();">PoC visit using IE11</a>

It may be possible to make this PoC work in Edge, too. Here is a stacktrace of where the source is accessed:

Error

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for your submission. I will investigate and get back to you shortly.

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

@albinowax,

Thanks again! However I was unable to reproduce your PoC in both Explorer 8 and 11. I keep getting this error instead

Regards.

activities.message: Interesting, it works for me with IE11 on my home computer too. Perhaps try adjusting the timeout in the poc to fire after 30 seconds instead of five seconds will fix it.
activities.markdown_message: Interesting, it works for me with IE11 on my home computer too. Perhaps try adjusting the timeout in the poc to fire after 30 seconds instead of five seconds will fix it.

activities.message:
Hi,

Unfortunately, I was not able to reproduce it. Would you mind recording a short video while you execute your PoC?

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

Unfortunately, I was not able to reproduce it. Would you mind recording a short video while you execute your PoC?

Regards.

For reference, here's the vulnerable (and de-minified) function taken from https://store.starbucks.co.uk/on/demandware.static/Sites-StarbucksUK-Site/-/en_GB/v1497946461985/js/generic.min.js

_observeHistory = function () {
                if (location.hash) {
                    if (_currentHash != location.hash) {
                        _currentHash = location.hash;
                        $('a[href$="' + _currentHash + '"]').click();
                    }
                }
                else if (_currentHash) {
                    _currentHash = '';
                    $(document).trigger(RESET_EVENT);
                }
            };

activities.message:
Hi @albinowax,

Thank you very much for the additional information. I have escalated this report to team for further review. We will get back to you as soon as we have an update.

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @albinowax,

Thank you very much for the additional information. I have escalated this report to team for further review. We will get back to you as soon as we have an update.

Regards.

activities.message: @albinowax- are you able to repro this without using a third party website to test your html?
activities.markdown_message: @albinowax- are you able to repro this without using a third party website to test your html?

activities.message: I'm not sure I understand the logic behind the question, but you could always use a data URL eg copy+paste data:text/html,foo<h1>bar
activities.markdown_message: I'm not sure I understand the logic behind the question, but you could always use a data URL eg copy+paste data:text/html,foo<h1>bar

activities.message: @albinowax- I was attempting to reproduce this by opening the html file in IE11 and it is not reproducing. The only way I am able to get it to reproduce is going via hackvector. Are you able to reproduce this without going via hackvector?
activities.markdown_message: @albinowax- I was attempting to reproduce this by opening the html file in IE11 and it is not reproducing. The only way I am able to get it to reproduce is going via hackvector. Are you able to reproduce this without going via hackvector?

activities.message: There's nothing special about hackvertor and it's owned by Gareth who reported this bug, but I've put the poc on my personal server and confirmed it works fine there too: █████████
activities.markdown_message: There's nothing special about hackvertor and it's owned by Gareth who reported this bug, but I've put the poc on my personal server and confirmed it works fine there too: █████████

activities.message:
Hi @albinowax,  

Thank you for your patience while we investigated your report. As you might have heard, Starbucks has taken down its consumer site of 'store.starbucks.co.uk' and as a result I am closing your report as Resolved. 

It was a pleasure working with you and we hope to work with you soon on future reports. 

Thanks, 
@overice
activities.markdown_message:
